title: Excerpt

fields.name: excerpt
fields.instructions: This is the workaround for Pages not having excerpts in WP. For blog Posts and Project instances, continue to use the built-in Excerpt or leave it blank and WP will just grab the first bit of Editor content, although a hand-crafted Excerpt is preferable though since the first paragraph of Editor stuff may not be ideal as an excerpt. For Language instances, use Background.
fields.placeholder: 1) No HTML please! Let's keep it simple since it will be used in places like the Page Hero summary/intro, page landing lists or cards. 2) No newlines. I only added this field as Text Area instead of Text so that it's easier to read/write. 3) I'm cutting it off at 255 chars. If this is a problem, let's discuss, but it will allow for some super-consistent styling and layouts.

description: Custom excerpt to override WP's (more info shown below the actual field you'll be editing)

title: Home Page Settings

fields.label: Explanation
fields.message: This stuff is specific to the Home page based on the 1-video, 2-image (card) layout we decided on. We can adjust slightly if needed, but without solid direction and concrete ideas on Home layout, this is what we'll have for this scope.

fields.label: YouTube Single-video EMBED URL
fields.name: you_tube_url
fields.instructions: Be sure to use the EMBED url, e.g. "https://www.youtube.com/embed/eiW59UUivc0" sans quotes. You can technically use a playlist for this one, but just note that it's not going to be fancy/tiled via API like the other pages. We're going for "Big Home Interesting ELA-reppin' Video".

fields.label: Number Of Recent Posts To Show
fields.name: num_recent_posts

fields.label: DEPRECATED: FB Feed Iframe Code
fields.name: fb_feed_iframe_html
fields.instructions:
THIS HAS BEEN COMMENTED OUT IN THE CODE as we decided to axe the FB feed. If that decision changes, let The Jason know. In that event, we pretty much used same format as old site with some other additions. Decent chance this code will never change, but here are some tips:

1. Can use this page to generate it: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/plugins/page-plugin/
2. Paste in the path to your FB profile
3. Click the iFrame tab
4. remove the "appId&########" portion of the code, e.g. &appId=1156079591084825 (including the ampersand)
fields.default_value: <iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/page.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Felalliance&tabs=timeline&width=340&height=500&small_header=false&adapt_container_width=true&hide_cover=false&show_facepile=false" width="340" height="500" style="border:none;overflow:hidden" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; picture-in-picture; web-share"></iframe>

sub_fields.label: Heading
sub_fields.name: heading
sub_fields.placeholder: Heading text to show in card

sub_fields.label: Link Type (sorry you have to fill this out)
sub_fields.name: link_type

sub_fields.label: Text
sub_fields.name: description
sub_fields.placeholder: This is the workaround for WP not supporting Excerpts for Pages (without PHP or plugin steps), so type whatever you want instead of leaning on Excerpt for this. It will be Summary/intro text that appears in the featured "card" or whatever we go with. Keep it simple as there won't be a ton of space, and we don't want to ellipsize something that's meant to brief in the first place. There's an ACF "character limit" option if we need to enforce that. Also be sure not to use new lines/paragraphs.

sub_fields.placeholder: This is the workaround for WP not supporting Excerpts for Pages (without PHP or plugin steps), so type whatever you want instead of leaning on Excerpt for this. It will be Summary/intro text that appears in the featured "card" or whatever we go with. Keep it simple as there won't be a ton of space, and we don't want to ellipsize something that's meant to brief in the first place. There's an ACF "character limit" option if we need to enforce that. Also be sure not to use new lines/paragraphs.

description: Things that apply only to the Home page

title: Location Info

fields.label: Usage & Instructions
fields.message:
The fields above

  • Name is what you will see in the lists within the WP admin UI. @Ross: small update: in case you haven't been already, use the same "Name" as you do for City. I'm now using it for sorting.
  • Slug is not used anywhere so far, but it basically should just be hypenated-lowercase variation of the Name, e.g. al-hamdaniyah.
  • Parent should be set to None. The only reason for including it at all is so checkboxes will appear in a Language instance when adding Locations. Otherwise, it was a wide-open search with potential for problems. Long story!
  • Description is another WP default, so far not being used, but again could feel useful in map popups.

Instructions

  1. Create and edit locations here only.
  2. Use them in Language instances, but do not create them there. Couldn't find a way to disable it!

fields.label: City
fields.name: city
fields.placeholder: so far not using in UI but seems useful

fields.label: Country
fields.name: country
fields.placeholder: so far not using in UI but seems useful

fields.label: Continent
fields.name: continent
fields.instructions: @Ross if you need more, let me know, they are easy to add. It was originally a full-on custom post type but there were problems and it was overkill anyway.

description: Lat, lon, city, etc. (used by language/s)

fields.label: Icon Color
fields.name: icon_color
fields.instructions: The icon color for this project when shown on a projects map (at time of writing, just /projects)

title: Site-wide Settings

fields.label: Explanation
fields.message: At the time of writing, this stuff is intended to be used in the footer. Ideally it would not go into the Home page, but it seemed equally unintuitive to create a Custom Post Type for it. ACF Pro evidently has something like Site Settings, but not worth the $49/yr, so here we are.

fields.label: Newsletter Form
fields.name: newsletter
fields.instructions: This is all HTML for the MailChip newsletter signup form, formerly its own page called "Announcement Form". Will likely need to style via CSS.
fields.default_value:
Subscribe to our mailing list

* indicates required

description: For things like contact info and other footer stuff, etc.

fields.label: Associated Project
fields.name: project
fields.instructions: Select an associated project if relevant

sub_fields.label: NYC Language Map URL
sub_fields.name: nyc_lang_map
sub_fields.placeholder: Link to something in the NYC Lang map

fields.label: Previous Research
fields.name: prev_research
fields.instructions: An outbound link will be featured above the content to Glottolog page if there is one.

fields.label: ELA's Work
fields.name: ela_work
fields.instructions: This content will be shown as a heading-less intro (same concept as Background) and will include a section called Texts if there is a Drive URL.

fields.label: Additional Info
fields.name: addl_info
fields.instructions: Catch-all for anything extra and non-standardized, e.g. Garifuna nursery rhymes

title: YouTube Playlist ID

fields.label: YouTube Playlist ID
fields.name: id
fields.instructions: Due to so many variations of YouTube URLs, we will use JUST the ID here, e.g. "PLcXFPx-z7B0oRykn98F41QRn2xLA3TxRX" sans quotes, obtained from the  full URL of https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLcXFPx-z7B0oRykn98F41QRn2xLA3TxRX
fields.placeholder: Enter JUST the YouTube playlist ID

fields.label: (Internal, optional) YouTube Playlist Full URL
fields.name: url
fields.instructions: This field is just a convenience QC check to make sure you've got the right playlist. It is not used in code and is entirely optional, but encouraged as it semi-validates the "YouTube Playlist ID" field (assuming the ID was copied properly!). Just paste the whole URL in, e.g. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLcXFPx-z7B0pC_zM4V0Tjbie76ObfAR5E

description: YouTube playlist ID for this Post or Page
